MS MCQs

    Secure Windows Server DNS

    »

    1. Which of the following statements best describes split DNS?

      Split DNS enables an organization to implement a different DNS namespace internally and externally.

      Split DNS enables an organization to implement the same DNS namespace internally and externally.

      Split DNS enables an organization to implement their internal DNS namespace as a subdomain of their external DNS namespace.


    2. When implementing DNS policies, which of the following statements about zone scopes is true?

      A zone scope represents unique instances of a group of settings that control DNS server recursion.

      A zone scope represents the IPv4 or IPv6 subnet from which queries are sent to a DNS server.

      A zone scope can contain its own set of DNS resource records.


    3. Which of the following DNS security features in Windows Server uses signed zones?

      DANE

      DNS cache locking

      DNSSEC
